p: As demonstrated by the recent epidemics of EBOV and MERS, and by the global HIV pandemic, viral cross-species transmissions (CST) can be devastating [ 1, 2]. As such, understanding the propensity and ability of viral pathogens to cross the species barrier is of vital public health importance. Of particular interest are transmissions that not only “spillover” into a single individual of a new host species, but that result in a virus actually establishing a sustained chain of transmission and becoming endemic in the new host population (“host switching”) [ 3].
